title: INfinance
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: ‘I’d hate to turn her over to the state’: My mother, who has dementia, refuses to be put in a facility. What can we do?
items.description: “She has never been willing to sign a power of attorney.”

items.title: Be ready with these portfolio changes if the shutdown damages the Fed’s credibility
items.description: The Fed is making decisions without actual data — but investors are still banking on rate cuts.

items.title: Inflation was out of control in retirement, so I went back to work. I’m still working at 66. Was I right?
items.description: “Be more concerned with outliving inflation than Social Security.”

items.title: ‘I’m stumped’: I put $3,000 on my credit card during a vacation and my credit score plunged. Why is it so volatile?
items.description: “Doesn’t a 30-year history of good credit count for anything?”

items.title: Is the stock market open on Columbus Day/Indigenous Peoples’ Day? Does the post office deliver mail?
items.description: Be prepared for plenty of closures on Monday.

items.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek

items.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
items.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

items.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat

items.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
items.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

items.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.
